title: Allow the user to control the mount points of its win32 drives
body: For example on my cygwin install I switched from /cygdrive/c/ to just /c/ to be more compatible with git (for win32) bash sessions and easier to type.

comments.body: This should be configurable in a config file like /etc/fstab.  The existing "/mnt/<drive-letter>" would just be the default you set up on installation.
Also, it should be possible to mount volumes that do not have a drive letter assigned on the host os
Or just mount them to `/c/` by default. I came here specifically to vote for this :)
